title: West Bank's Birzeit University still reeling one week after Israeli army fired on students
subhead: Israeli soldiers intervened on January 6 during a rally in solidarity with Palestinian prisoners, at which the film 'The Voice of Hind Rajab' was to be screened. Around a dozen people were injured.

title: Trump says Iran executions stopped as Tehran postpones hanging of protester
France to send troops to Greenland for joint exercise with several European countries
X announces measures to prevent Grok from undressing images
subhead: The announcement comes after California's attorney general launched an investigation on Wednesday into Musk's xAI – the developer of Grok, following global backlash over its generation of sexualized photos of women and children.

title: From fighting immigration to the annexation of Greenland, Katie Miller, chief 'MAGA Mom'
subhead: The wife of Stephen Miller, the influential White House adviser, sparked outrage among diplomats after posting a map of Greenland repainted with the American flag on X (formerly Twitter) on January 3. This 'trad wife,' devoted to Donald Trump, spreads her ideas through a highly popular podcast in the MAGA universe.

title: A rare 16th-century drawing by the master Hans Baldung Grien auctioned in Paris
subhead: The portrait of Susanna Pfeffinger, which has remained within her descendants' family, is valued at between €1.5 million and €3 million.

title: Behind France's declining birthrate, the complex question of wanting children
subhead: Official data released Tuesday show France's birth rate has reached its lowest point in more than a century. When it comes to understanding the decline in births, it is difficult to distinguish between individual choices, social norms and the various constraints faced by couples.

title: Zelensky to declare 'state of emergency' in Ukraine's energy sector
In Dubai, behind the unprecedented seizure of real estate assets from drug traffickers
Quebec's premier resigns before fall vote with separatists leading polls
Iran's crackdown reaches unprecedented levels: 'There were layers of bodies stacked on top of each other'
South Korean prosecutors seek death penalty for Yoon Suk Yeol over martial law declaration
AFCON 2025: Morocco beats Nigeria on penalties to reach final against Senegal
Astronauts from the Crew-11 space mission leave the ISS
50 French farmers arrested after storming agricultural ministry building in Paris
French Assemblée Nationale rejects no-confidence motions filed by LFI and RN in protest against free trade treaty
Venezuela's interim president announces 'new political era'
US-backed plan to end war in Gaza moves into second phase
Russia steps up Ukraine strikes as polar cold grips the country
After celebrating Maduro ouster, Venezuelan migrants in US fear what lies ahead
subhead: After celebrating the abduction of Nicolas Maduro, Venezuelan asylum seekers in the US have begun to have doubts. In Denver, Colorado, where they number in the tens of thousands, many now fear having to go back to their country with the Chavistas still in power.

title: Reza Pahlavi, the son of Iran's shah fanning the flames of revolt
subhead: The son of Iran's former monarch, driven out of the country by the 1979 Islamic Revolution, has repeatedly called for protests against the Tehran regime. Crowds chant his name, and from his US exile, he has increasingly positioned himself as a leader of the movement.

title: 'The Islamic Republic of Iran is entering its final phase'
subhead: Hemmed in by domestic and external crises, the Islamic Republic of Iran is now finding itself with nowhere left to turn, analyzes Farid Vahid, the co-director of the Observatory of North Africa and the Middle East at the Fondation Jean Jaurès.

title: Trump's disastrous undermining of the Federal Reserve
France's population decline presents a political challenge
'In the face of Donald Trump's imperialism, realism means defending the law as an indispensable tool'
